title: Ticket #6386: Add DAGMan knob for job submits to override submit cycle time limit
description:
DAGMan submits batches of jobs in submit cycles, which are scheduled at regular time intervals. The length of these time intervals is set in DAGMAN_USER_LOG_SCAN_INTERVAL.

Sometimes there are more available jobs than can be submitted in a single time interval. This causes DAGMan to overrun the time limit, at which point it is forced to sit out the next time interval (doing nothing) until it can start submitting jobs again.

Add a knob which allows DAGMan to ignore the time limit, and continue submitting jobs until either all jobs are submitted, or we run into one of the other limits (DAGMAN_MAX_SUBMITS_PER_INTERVAL, DAGMAN_MAX_IDLE_JOBS, etc.)
